serialSupport

Class SerineSerial

  • java.lang.Object
    • serialSupport.SerineSerial
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    jssc.SerialPortEventListener, Postable

    public class SerineSerial
extends java.lang.Object
implements jssc.SerialPortEventListener, Postable
    This class allows implementing a serial channel of communication for the Serine Protocol. The messages should be posted at postHere method. The method setAddressed should be used to indicate the Postable object to which the messages coming from the serial port will be sent.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect(java.lang.String portName,
                       int rate,
                       int databits,
                       int stopbits,
                       int parity)
        Allows identifying, opening, and connecting the stream of the serial port.
        Parameters:
        portName - for example, "COM5", in Windows.
        rate - a valid baud rate
        databits - number of data bits
        stopbits - number of stop bits
        parity - parity bit
        Returns:
        true if the port was correctly opened.

      • connect

        public boolean connect(java.lang.String portName,
                       int rate)
        A simplified version of connect, in which N = 8, stopbits = 1, no parity
        Parameters:
        portName - for example, "COM5", in Windows.
        rate - a valid baud rate
        Returns:
        true if the port was correctly opened.

        public boolean isConnected()

        public java.lang.String getPortName()
        Returns the port name as, for example, "COM5", in Windows.
        Returns:
        a string with the port name.

      • setAddressed

        public void setAddressed(Postable dispatcher)
        Allows to identify to whom the messages will be send. This guy can be either a virtual device or another Postable class that is able to handle and dispatch messages to other Postables. the virtual device to which the messages will be sent.
        Parameters:
        dispatcher - the Postable to be addressed

      • postHere

        public boolean postHere(java.lang.String message)
        Allows send a string (or a valid message) through the serial port.
        Specified by:
        postHere in interface Postable
        Parameters:
        message - the string to be send through the serial port.
        Returns:
        true if all bytes were sent.

      • serialEvent

        public void serialEvent(jssc.SerialPortEvent event)
        It handles the bytes coming in from the serial port and send them to the Serine buffer. This method should not be called by the user.
        Specified by:
        serialEvent in interface jssc.SerialPortEventListener
        Parameters:
        event - RXCHAR is the only event that matters.

      • close

        public void close()
        Friendly closes the serial port.
